questions.prompt: A binomial distribution requires which of the following?
options: Fixed number of trials with constant success probability
questions.explanation: Binomial distributions model a fixed number of independent trials, each with the same probability of success.

questions.prompt: If X ~ Binomial(n=10, p=0.3), what is E[X]?
questions.explanation: For a binomial distribution, E[X] = np = 10 × 0.3 = 3.

questions.prompt: The Poisson distribution is often used to model the number of events occurring in a fixed interval of time or space.
questions.explanation: Poisson distributions model rare events occurring at a constant average rate over time/space.

questions.prompt: For a Poisson distribution with λ = 4, what is both E[X] and Var(X)?
questions.explanation: A unique property of Poisson: both the mean and variance equal λ. So E[X] = Var(X) = 4.

questions.prompt: The binomial coefficient "n choose k" is written as C(n,k) or using ______ notation.
questions.explanation: The binomial coefficient is denoted C(n,k) or (n choose k), used in binomial probability calculations.

questions.prompt: A standard normal distribution has which parameters?
questions.explanation: The standard normal distribution has mean μ=0 and standard deviation σ=1.

questions.prompt: If X ~ N(100, 25), what is the standard deviation?
questions.explanation: N(μ, σ²) notation uses variance σ². So σ² = 25 means σ = 5.

questions.prompt: Approximately 68% of data in a normal distribution falls within one standard deviation of the mean.
questions.explanation: The empirical rule: about 68% within 1σ, 95% within 2σ, and 99.7% within 3σ of the mean.

questions.prompt: To standardize a normal random variable X with mean μ and standard deviation σ, we use:
questions.explanation: The z-score formula Z = (X - μ)/σ converts any normal distribution to standard normal.

questions.prompt: The normal distribution is also called the ______ distribution due to its shape.
questions.explanation: The normal distribution is bell-shaped, hence the name "bell curve."

questions.prompt: The exponential distribution is often used to model:
options: Time between events in a Poisson process
questions.explanation: Exponential distributions model waiting times between events in a Poisson process.

questions.prompt: The exponential distribution has the memoryless property.
questions.explanation: The memoryless property P(X > s+t | X > s) = P(X > t) is unique to the exponential distribution among continuous distributions.

questions.prompt: A uniform distribution U(a,b) has mean equal to:
questions.explanation: For a uniform distribution on [a,b], the mean is the midpoint: (a+b)/2.

questions.prompt: The chi-square distribution is commonly used in:
questions.explanation: Chi-square tests are used for testing independence and goodness of fit.

questions.prompt: The geometric distribution models the number of trials until the first ______.
questions.explanation: The geometric distribution counts trials until the first success occurs.
